newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Chong Kun Dang chairman offers to buy company shrs.
newsitem.headline: Chong Kun Dang chairman offers to buy company shrs.

text.p: The chairman and biggest shareholder of South Korea's Chong Kun Dang Corp has offered to buy five percent of the company's shares at 80,000 won per share over the counter, the Securities Supervisory Board said on Tuesday.
Chong Kun Dang shares last traded at 64,400 won on Tuesday morning, down 600 won from Monday's close.
Lee Jang-han offered to buy 154,370 Chong Kun Dang shares between April 12 and May 2 to "secure stable managment right" of the company, the board said in a statement.
The purchase, to be handled by Hanwha Securities, would raise Lee's stake to 17.35 percent, it said.
Brokers said the stock fell despite the announcement because talk that Lee would seek to buy the shares had been reflected on the company's share prices.
